ext_descriptions.ext_description:
An Independent_property identifies a type of property. It is independent of its application to characterize a product or an activity.
The physical property Kinematic viscosity, defined in ISO 31, is an example of Independent_property.
a text that provides additional information about the Independent_property.
a string that specifies the identifier of the Independent_property.
a string that specifies the type of the Independent_property. 'Kinematic viscosity' is an example of property_type.

An Independent_property_relationship specifies a relationship between two instances of Independent_property.
An Independent_property_relationship may be used to indicate that the values of a Independent_property can be derived from the values of another Independent_property.
a text that specifies additional information about the Independent_property_relationship. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the related Independent_property specifies the second of the two Independent_property objects related by the Independent_property_relationship.
The semantics of this attribute is defined by the attribute relation_type.

the relating specifies the first of the two intances of Independent_property related by the Independent_property_relationship.
The semantics of this attribute is defined by the attribute relation_type.

the relation_type specifies the meaning of the relationship.
Where applicable, the following values shall be used:
'decomposition': The Independent_property_relationship defines a relationship where the related Independent_property is a member of a group of Independent_property objects that is established by the relating Property.
'dependency': The related Independent_property is dependent upon the relating Independent_property.
'hierarchy': The application object defines a hierarchical relationship where the related Independent_property is on a lower level than the relating Independent_property.
'peer': The related Independent_property and relating Independent_property are on equal footing.
'substitution': The Independent_property_relationship defines a relationship where the related Independent_property replaces the relating Property.
'value domain': The Independent_property_relationship defines a relationship where the values assigned to the relating Independent_property shall be within the limits indicated by the values assigned to the related Independent_property.
